subject: Re: [junit] Informative equals
msgSnippet: Are you trying to test your equals() method or merely using it to verify two objects are the same as part of another test? On Fri, Jun 26, 2015 at 5:09 PM,
messageBody:
Are you trying to test your equals() method or merely using it to verify two objects are the same as part of another test?

On Fri, Jun 26, 2015 at 5:09 PM, aleks_ya@... [junit] <junit@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
Â 

Hello!

I have a problem with equal classes that have many fields. I can't understand which fields is not equal. I have to compare long toString output from two non-equal objects. Or write assertEquals() for every field.

I'm seeking "reflectEquals" matcher which prints name of the non-equal field.
Do you know similar matchers?

Thanks!





--
Maybe she awoke to see the roommate's boyfriend swinging from the chandelier wearing a boar's head.

Something which you, I, and everyone else would call "Tuesday", of course.
